thread.title: Truck ploughs into parade crowd in New Orleans, 28 hurt
thread.title_full: Truck ploughs into parade crowd in New Orleans, 28 hurt

author: David Millward
title: Truck ploughs into parade crowd in New Orleans, 28 hurt
text:
Truck ploughs into parade crowd in New Orleans, 28 hurt A dozen seriously hurt after truck ploughs in parade David Millward , US Correspondent 26 February 2017 • 2:37am 
N early 30 people have been injured when a truck ploughed into a parade in New Orleans. 
Initially it was reported that a dozen people people were in a critical condition. 
But later reports suggested none of the injuries were life threatening. 
Those injured were taken to seven different hospitals, the New Orleans Advocate reported. 
The youngest victim is understood to be three years old and the oldest around 40. 
The truck ploughed into revellers in the Krewe of Endymion parade, which one of several events leading up to the main Mardi Gras festivities. 
Local news sources said it is believed that a drunk driver was responsible for the carnage. At least one person has been arrested. First pictures from Orleans & Carrollton, where at least a dozen are critical after a vehicle slammed into the Endymion crowd. pic.twitter.com/MMpiu4GyoT — Danny Monteverde (@DCMonteverde) February 26, 2017 
C arrie Kinsella told the paper that she felt the silver truck whisking past her. “I actually literally felt it. I felt a rush it was so fast,” she said. 
Another witness, Kourtney McKinnis, 20, said the driver was "kind of out of it." 
Another witness said the truck hit a white saloon car, sending it crashing into a utility pole. 
The Krewe of Endymion parade has attracted a number of celebrity guests in the past, including Fats Domino, Smokey Robinson, Britney Spears, Chuck Norris and the Beach Boys. 
The incident took place five hours after a man was shot and wounded. Police believe the gun was fired by accident.
